column4: I had windows 7 & ubuntu latest sde by side,  have just done rcovery for windows and now I get "no such partition grub resque"
now i have installed a new ubuntu and i still see thee message!
have you checked if ubuntu is even there?
boot a ubuntu cd or usb open gparted and look if ubuntu is still on the HD.
my "try ubuntu" wont work i have just installed a fresh ubuntu again ow i think i have 2 installations of ubuntu
you will need to boot the cd to a desktop to fix grub and get other info really.
im downloading boot repair and will make a bootable usb, will that work?
possibly, but save the bootscript it makes if it doesn't to post.
you can look in gparted, sudo fdisk -l will tell you of the partitions.
to be honest we are missing a lot of info to really help you.

i had ubuntu and windows 7 side by side for  months, today i did a recovery for windows and that messed up the grub, i cant boot to windows nor ubuntu anymore all i get is partition message with grub rescue , so now i run live cd and did another ubuntu installation thought i lost my old one and now i think i have more than 5 partition in /dev
your words mean very little to be honest to may variables here. You do not even know what is on thew HD as pf now.
its very clear, if i run fdisk -l , i will get:
pastebin the terminal output of fdisk
that is all I have to hear good luck.
without the bootscript your really risking many more problems and little sure help from the channel.
